components.description:
A gender-unspecified person taking a soothing bath in a white tub with a shower head. Commonly used for various content concerning bathing, washing, cleaning, and bathrooms more generally. May also represent relaxation and self-care.

The appearance of the person, depicted in default yellow, varies. Apple's person is wearing a green shower cap, WhatsApp's a green washcloth. Google’s person appears to be playing in a bubble bath, with soapsuds atop their ahead. Other major vendors show the head of the bather with short, brown or blonde hair. Skin tone modifiers are available on supported platforms.

Vendors implement the same or a similar tub and shower head as for their üõÅ Bathtub, but with a person taking/having a bath.
components.title: Bath

title: Bath

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A person enjoying a bath, either with or without a shower over the top. Differs from the¬†Bathtub Emoji, as this is a person bathing ‚Äúhaving  http://emojipedia.org/bath/
emoji_net_data.name: person taking bath

bn:00113830a: Bright and colourless; reflecting equal quantities of all frequencies of visible light.
Being of the achromatic color of maximum lightness; having little or no hue owing to reflection of almost all incident light

bn:00099776a: Free from dirt or impurities; or having clean habits

bn:00083165v: Clean one's body by immersion into water
To submerge the body into water either for washing or for recreation.
To clean oneself by immersion in water or using water; to take a bath, have a bath.
To clean oneself by immersion in water.

bn:00071324n: A plumbing fixture that sprays water over you
An area in which one bathes underneath a spray of water.
Place in which a person bathes under a spray of water
The part of a shower where the water comes out.
A device for bathing by which water is made to fall on the body from a height, either from a tank or by the action of a pump.
A bathroom (or area within a bathroom) in which a shower is not surrounded by any barrier
A shower is a place in which a person bathes under a spray of, typically warm or hot, water.
Instance of using of this device.

bn:00008995n: A room containing a bath where one can bathe.
A room containing a bath or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet
A room with a toilet, but no shower or bathtub, and typically no sink; a water closet.
Room with a toilet (the device) and, typically, a sink, but no shower or bathtub.
A bathroom or lavatory in a home containing a sink and a toilet, but no bathtub or shower.
A room with a toilet (the device), sink, and bathtub.
A bathroom is a room for personal hygiene, generally containing a bathtub or a shower, and possibly also a bidet.
A room (as in a residence) containing a bathtub or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet

bn:00008992n: Large container in which a person may bathe.
A tub or pool which is used for bathing.
A large container for holding water in which a person may bathe (take a bath).
A tub or pool which is used for bathing: bathtub.
A bathtub, bath or tub is a large container for holding water in which a person may bathe.
A large open container for water, in which a person may wash their body
A relatively large open container that you fill with water and use to wash the body
